Legal_Issue: Whether A011 qualifies as a refugee sur place based on membership in a particular social group under s. 96 of IRPA
Application_Facts: A011, a Tamil male, traveled to Canada on the Ocean Lady; RPD found him a refugee sur place due to perceived political opinion and Tamil ethnicity
Decision_Outcome: The decision was incorrect; case referred back to RPD for reconsideration based on mixed motives
Grounds_for_Claim: Persecution based on perceived political opinion and ethnicity; possible membership in a particular social group
Legal_Standard: Refugee definition under s. 96 of IRPA
Assessment_Factor: Whether passengers of the Ocean Lady constitute a 'particular social group'
Applicable_Legislation: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), s. 96
Procedural_Issue: Standard of review: correctness vs. reasonableness
Evidence_Used: RPD findings on perceived political opinion and Tamil ethnicity
Application_Basis: Refugee sur place claim based on membership in a particular social group and perceived political opinion
Evidence_Assessed: Nature of group identity among Ocean Lady passengers
Relief_Sought: Recognition as a refugee under s. 96 of IRPA
Governing_Rule: Under s. 96 of IRPA, a refugee must face persecution due to race, religion, nationality, political opinion, or membership in a particular social group
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Uncertainty whether passengers constitute a 'particular social group'
Outcome: Referred back to RPD for reconsideration
Cause_Description: Discrepancies in judicial interpretations of 'particular social group' led to inconsistent refugee status determinations
Evidence_Handling: Judicial review analyzed evidence used by RPD
Evidence_Issues: Ambiguity in defining social group membership among asylum seekers arriving together
Evidence_Assessment: Court questioned whether shared experience of travel constitutes a particular social group
Decision_Rationale: Decision based on mixed motives rather than clear social group membership
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of clarity in defining 'particular social group' in context of sur place claims
Legal_Standard_Applied: Reasonableness vs. correctness in administrative review
